sentences.sentence: The Dancing Monkeys
A king had some monkeys trained to dance.
Since they were already used to copying men’s actions, they learned very quickly,
and when dressed in their rich clothes and masks( 面具 ), they danced as well as anyone in the King’s palace.
They danced for many nights and everybody loved their dance.
Then someone, for a joke, took from his pocket a handful of( 少量的 ) nuts( 坚果 ) and threw them upon the stage.
At the sight of the nuts( 坚果 ), the monkeys forgot their dancing and became (as indeed they were) monkeys instead of actors.
Pulling off( 取下 ) their masks( 面具 ) and tearing off( 撕下 ) their clothes,
they fought with one another for the nuts( 坚果 ).
The show thus came to an end( 结束 ), with the audience( 观众 ) laughing loudly at( 嘲笑 ) the monkeys.
MORAL: You can’t hide your true nature forever( 永远 ).
The Deer( 鹿 ) and the Vine( 藤蔓 )
A deer( 鹿 ), being chased( 追捕 ) by hunters( 猎人 ), hid himself behind the large leaves of a vine( 藤蔓 ).
The hunters( 猎人 ) passed by( 经过 ) without noticing him.
Thinking that the danger had passed, the deer( 鹿 ) began to eat the leaves of the vine( 藤蔓 ).
One of the hunters( 猎人 ) heard this and looked back.
He saw the deer( 鹿 ) and then shot him.
The deer( 鹿 ), close to death, said,
“I deserve( 应得 ) this. I shouldn’t have treated the vine( 藤蔓 ) that saved me this way.”
MORAL: The ungrateful( 忘恩负义的 ) will not be helped a second time.
The Dog and the Rabbit
A dog was chasing( 追捕 ) a rabbit, sometimes biting her with his teeth as if he would eat her,
and other times playing with her as if with another dog.
The rabbit said to him, “What do you want with me?
If you are a friend, why do you bite me so hard?
If you are an enemy, why do you play with me?”
MORAL: Those whom you cannot always trust are not your friends.
The Dog and the Shadow( 影子 )
A dog was crossing a river bridge with some meat in his mouth.
Suddenly, he saw his own shadow( 影子 ) in the water, and thought it was another dog with a bigger piece of meat.
He dropped his piece of meat and attacked the other dog, to try and get the bigger piece from him.
So he lost his piece of meat, which dropped into the river and floated away( 漂走 ).
MORAL: It is not wise to be too greedy( 贪婪的 ).
The Dog in the Hay( 干草堆 )
A barking( 狂吠的 ) dog was lying on the hay( 干草堆 ) that the farmer had put down for the cows.
The cows could not eat the hay( 草料 ) because they were scared( 害怕 ) of the dog.
“What a selfish( 自私的 ) dog!” said one of them.
“He can’t eat the hay( 草料 ) himself, but he won’t allow us to eat it either.”
MORAL: We should not prevent( 阻止 ) others from enjoying what we can’t enjoy ourselves.
The Dog, the Rooster( 公鸡 ), and the Fox( 狐狸 )
A dog and a rooster( 公鸡 ) became great friends, and agreed to travel together.
At sunset( 日落 ), the rooster( 公鸡 ) flew up into a tree to sleep, while the dog lay down in a hole in the tree.
The next morning, the rooster( 公鸡 ) woke up( 醒来 ), and as usual, started to crow( 打鸣 ).
A fox( 狐狸 ) heard this, and wishing to make breakfast of him, came and stood under the tree and told him to come down.
“I would like,” he said, “to make friends with someone who has such a beautiful voice.”
The rooster( 公鸡 ) replied, “Would you just wake up( 唤醒 ) my friend who is sleeping at the bottom of the tree?
He’ll open the door and let you in.”
The fox( 狐狸 ) knocked on the tree, and the dog came out and tore him apart( 扯开 ).
MORAL: He who lays traps( 圈套 ) for others is often caught by them himself.

article_info.previous: 在昨天的故事里，猫变成的新娘无论表现得多么像人，当看见老鼠的时候总会暴露自己的本性，这个故事告诉我们江山易改，本性难移。
article_info.share_words: The ungrateful will not be helped a second time.   He who lays traps for others is often caught by them himself.

question.cn: 在故事The Dancing Monkeys中，当有人向猴子扔坚果的时候，发生了什么？
question.en: In the story the Dancing Monkeys, what happened when someone threw nuts to the monkeys?

options.en: The monkeys fought with each other for the nuts.

options.cn: 猴子们吃了坚果然后跳舞。
options.en: The monkeys ate the nuts and then danced.

analysis: 文中提到“Pulling off their masks and tearing off their clothes, they fought with one another for the nuts.”可知它们为了坚果争斗，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Dog, the Rooster, and the Fox中，狐狸为什么想要和公鸡作朋友？
question.en: In the story the Dog, the Rooster, and the Fox, why did the fox want to make friends with the rooster?

options.en: The fox wanted to eat the rooster.
The fox liked to make friends.
The fox liked the rooster's voice.

analysis: 文中提到“A fox heard this, and wishing to make breakfast of him, came and stood under the tree.”因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Dog and the Shadow中，狗在水中看见了什么？
question.en: In the story the Dog and the Shadow, what did the dog see in the water?

analysis: 文中提到“Suddenly, he saw his own shadow in the water.”由此可知，狗在水中看到的是自己的倒影，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Dog in the Hay中，为什么牛认为狗是自私的？
question.en: In the story the Dog in the Hay, why did the cows think the dog was selfish?

options.en: The dog ate all the hay himself.

options.cn: 狗不吃草料，却阻止牛吃草料。
options.en: The dog couldn't eat the hay, but he wouldn't allow cows to eat it either.
The dog burnt up the hay.

analysis: 文中提到“‘what a selfish dog!’… he can't eat the hay himself, but he won't allow us to eat it either.” 可知牛认为狗自私的原因是它自己不吃草料，却阻止牛吃草料，因此选B。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第6天
